sentences.en: Any one may mouth out a passage with a theatrical cadence.
sentences.cn: 任何人都可以用演戏似的调子朗诵一段文章.

sentences.en: Cadence means the rise and fall of the voice in reading with rhythm.
sentences.cn: 顿挫抑扬是形容朗读时声音的高低曲折和和谐的的节奏.

sentences.en: Frances spoke with a soft, musical Edinburgh cadence.
sentences.cn: 弗朗西丝讲话时用一种柔和悦耳的爱丁堡声调.

sentences.en: He counted his cadence of cycling against the sweep second hand on his watch.
sentences.cn: 他按照手表秒针跳动的节奏,计算着蹬车的频率.

sentences.en: He is not attempting necessarily to reproduce the cadence of speech.
sentences.cn: 他不想刻意重复那种讲话的语调。

sentences.en: He liked the relaxed cadence of his retired life.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢退休生活的悠闲的节奏.

sentences.en: He reads loud, and the tone is in cadence.
sentences.cn: 他读起课文来,声音宏亮, 语气抑扬顿挫.

sentences.en: How is your working cadence? Can you quickly suit the new environment?
sentences.cn: 你觉得你的工作节奏 怎么样 ?是否很快可以适应新的环境?

sentences.en: Pay attention pause at the end of each cadence.
sentences.cn: 注意每个结尾的“延长”记号.

sentences.en: Pay attention to the pause at the end of each cadence.
sentences.cn: 注意每个结尾的延长记号.

sentences.en: the cadence of my mother’s voice
sentences.cn: 我母亲语调的抑扬顿挫

sentences.en: The cadence, words, and images will soothe your soul.
sentences.cn: 韵律 、 词句和影像会让你的情绪平和.

sentences.en: The essays are well - arranged and enriched by biblical allusions, metaphors and cadence.
sentences.cn: 这些散文不仅结构巧妙还大量使用了《圣经》的典故, 隐喻和基调.

sentences.en: The music is graceful and cheerful with a vivid cadence.
sentences.cn: 乐曲轻盈欢快,节奏鲜明.

sentences.en: There was an unfamiliar cadence in her voice.
sentences.cn: 她说话时带有一种不常听到的抑扬顿挫的声调.

sentences.en: To feel: The cadence and facial expression on line.
sentences.cn: 情感: 体验线材的韵律与表情. (规律:长短、对称、旋转、节奏等)

words.tran_cn: 终止式；下降调；韵律（等于cadence）；幼子之后裔

trans.tran_cn: （声音的）抑扬顿挫，节奏，韵律，调子
trans.tran_en: the way someone’s voice rises and falls, especially when reading out loud
